fava.functionable
Class Functionable<T1>

java.lang.Object
  fava.functionable.Functionable<T1>
Type Parameters:
T1 -
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T1>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FIterable, FList, FStream, Generator, RangeSet, Sequence
public abstract class Functionable<T1>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T1>

This is a base abstract class which provides a default implementation of some of the most common functional commands. Objects extending this class gain access to these methods, but will be required to implement the Iterable interface

Author:
Nathaniel Sherry, 2010-2011

map

public <T2> Functionable<T2> map(FnMap<T1,T2> f)
Applies the given FnMap function to each contained element. Returns a Functionable object representing the results of those applications.

Type Parameters:
T2 -
Parameters:
f - the mapping function to apply
Returns:
a Functionable object containing the results of applying the FnMap to the elements in this Functionable object

filter

public Functionable<T1> filter(FnMap<T1,java.lang.Boolean> f)
Applies the given FnMap function to each contained element. Returns a Functionable object containing the elements of this object for which the given function returned true.

Parameters:
f - the condition function to apply
Returns:
a Functionable object containing only those elements in this Functionable object for which the given function returned true

fold

public T1 fold(FnFold<T1,T1> f)
Applies the given FnFold function to consecutive contained elements, also threading a running sum or result from call to call. When the function has been applied to every element, the result will be a single value.

Parameters:
f - the folding function to apply
Returns:
the result of applying this function to all elements as if it were an n-ary function

fold

public <T2> T2 fold(T2 base,
                    FnFold<T1,T2> f)
Applies the given FnFold function to consecutive contained elements, also threading a running sum or result from call to call. When the function has been applied to every element, the result will be a single value. Since the return value may be of a different type than the contained elements, a starting value of that type is requried

Parameters:
f - the folding function to apply
Returns:
the result of applying this function to all elements as if it were an n-ary function

take

public Functionable<T1> take(int number)
Remove and return the first 'number' elements from this Functionalbe object

Parameters:
number - the number of elements to take
Returns:
a Functionalbe object containing the first 'number' elements from this Functionable object

takeWhile

public Functionable<T1> takeWhile(FnMap<T1,java.lang.Boolean> f)
Remove and return elements from this Functionable object while the elements satisfy the given condition function.

Parameters:
f - the condition function to apply
Returns:
a Functionable object containing elements from this Functionable object up until the point where an element fails to satisfy the given condition
